Basic details: Michael Green, a 49-year-old male, comes to the clinic complaining of back pain.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 99.1°F (37.3°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 78/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit on the examination table and occasionally wince in pain.
Place your hand on your lower back when asked where it hurts.
Exhibit stiffness when trying to stand up or sit down.
If MRI is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What is an MRI?”
Challenging question: “Is this just a muscle strain, or could it be something serious like a slipped disc?”
